The music and the crowd are both fun - not bro, yet not horribly hipster, and the dancing is a nice departure from the bump and grind.
author: Wade W.

description:
I went to Edinburgh Castle for the first time last Wednesday to meet up with a few friends for drinks.  In my personal opinion, Edinburgh Castle is the perfect dive bar.  We ordered pitchers of Smithwick's and fish and chips (the BEST fish and chips I have ever had) and talked in the quiet, relatively empty bar until DJ Matt showed up for 1964.  That is when Edinburgh Castle got crowded (in a good way) and a massive, 1960s-style dance party started.  

Logistics: 
- friendly bar tender
- attentive waitress
- great fish and chips
- reasonably priced well drinks ($5) and STRONG
- dance party every 2nd and 4th Wednesdays (1960s music)
- trivia night on Tuesdays

I am definitely going back to Edinburgh Castle (I really want to try Tuesday's trivia night), and I will recommend it to friends.
author: Rachel H.

description: Besides being surrounded by super-sketch crack heads and utterly doused in vinegar, this place is way kickin. This week, I went two days in a row to see Mr. Gnome and then Tempo No Tempo. They have an excellent sound system, so be sure to bring your earplugs to keep from sustaining auditory damage. The facilities are intimate but not elbow-to elbow claustrophobic--but be sure to flee for oxygen in between sets. The bathrooms are ridiculously excellent for a dive bar and actually have paper seat thingies. They also let a dog in there, which was awesome for drunken petting but not so great for hand smell. All in all, a great deal for your moola ($5 for the first show, $0 for the second (it pays to make friends with musicians!))
author: T.Z. R.

description: I always have a good time here. Seriously. Even when the music is bad, which isn't too often here, it's still fun. Hooray for the fabulous jukebox and for the general vibe of the crowd here.
author: Angela N.

description: Not a bad pub at all.  Been a couple times now and i like the place.  Nice and spacious inside, usually a cool crowd, and good music on the juke.  They also have a smoking room inside that hopefully is ventilated so you dont feel like you're in a death box.
author: Juv C.

description:
I try to limit my reviews to businesses that have fewer than 100 reveiws unless the place is outstanding or one to avoid or if i feel i've a story that someone out there would find funny. this falls in the outstanding category. Why? Several reasons;
1. Cuz I like whiskies. While I usually don't participate in the Scotch vs Bourbon rivalry, when I want scotch this is the place to go! I brought my twin sis from NYC here cuz we share the same love of whisky and have the same nose and lips. Are they related? I'd go with nurture over nature on this one. The cocktail waitresses and bartenders are sweet, they let us sample two different scotches before each round of scotch on the rocks. Too bad I don't remember which I liked best.
2. Live music. I even played a show here once and would do it again. Like the Hemlock or Elbo Room, you can drink in one room and if you feel like paying a small cover you can catch some local music in another. Though I think this may be only one or a few times a week. 
3. Rockin juke box. Band upstairs sounds boring, I'd rather have another scotch on the rocks. 
4. Fish and Chips. I always say there needs to be more watering holes that offer food, a fine distinction between restaurant bars. Fish and chips are super sustenance. 
5. Pool table, and a substantial variety of beers on tap, always a bonus.
6. Smoking area. Well, there isn't one, but guess I can't have everything. five outta six stars.
author: Tihani K.

description:
Even though I probably don't have the right type of haircut and my pants are not nearly as tight as they need to be for me to be in this place, my first experience at Edinburgh Castle was a pretty good one.

From the outside, you'd think that this place is just another one of those loud crowded "hey I'm cool because I go to bars in the Tenderloin" scenester hellhole bars. And while it is filled with hipster douchebags, the inside was a pleasant surprise. Tables line the wall instead of being in the middle of everything. Pool and darts on another level so you're not throwing sharp objects directly at scene mullets. Who would've thought that the layout of a bar should make sense!

They have a wide variety of beers on tap, including PBR. On Tap. That doesn't make sense to me, but if that's your bag, they have it. Their tonic apparently tasted "broken," and I don't think they use actual Coca-Cola in mixed drinks, but my 15 pints of Newcastle tasted fine. The whole place smells like vinegar which made me want to have some of their fish and chips, but I did not partake.

The jukebox is pretty good, too.
author: Alexis C.

description: Excellent beer on tap, trivia night, AND fish and chips delivered from next-ish store.  And it's got a literary vibe (in an in-your-cups kind of way), which means that it's my kind of place (I'm partial to in-your-cups, or is that in-my-cups?).  It is huge, which ordinarily would rule it out as my kind of place.  But it works, thanks to its literary air and its gustatory offerings (beer and fish-and-chips = party).
author: Laurel B.

description:
looks filthy & tiny outside but is a surprisingly large space. it does have a kinda funky aroma but its part of the experience.

fanfuckentastic selection of beers and if you want a little quiet time to lay the groundwork for some magic take your date upstairs where you can actually talk to one another.
author: Jeremy D.

description: This place really grossed me out. I guess I just don't "get" it. The whole place (particularly the bathrooms) was like something out of a horror movie - and not in a good artsy way! If you dig the dive bar scene, then by all means, "dive" into this place! Otherwise, there's plenty of other options for us princess-and-the-pea types.
author: Julia D.

description: awesome juke box - especially if you like the classics of the punk/indie/goth/experimental genre: joy division, nick cave, decendants, velvet underground, etc. - perfect music to drink your scotch to if you ask me.....which brings me to another point: the drinks - the collection of scotches is insane, the beers on tap all excellent choices, and the crowd is a good lot - freaks and geeks and hipsters and intellectual types.  The place is cavernous and looks like a castle inside - stone and wood and the fragrant scent of french fries with vinegar (yum).  The room where the bands play is tiny and way too hot, but if you're just going to drink in a grungy dark hole of a pub and kick back with your disgruntled over-educated friends, this is the place.  Also noteable is the Castle Quiz (tuesdays).  Cheers!
author: Lauren S.

description:
i'm always looking for an even half-way decent Tenderloin bar close to my sweet sweet banh mi place, and now i have another one.  800 Larkin ain't so bad either. ditto for fancy Olive bar.

came in on a random rainy monday at 7pm and were the only people at the bar.  it was a little spooky with all the (dirty) dusty decor and old-looking seats but i got right into my niche after a Boont's Amber.  my friend and i choked on a terrible sewage smell in the bathroom.   just don't have too many beers so you can stay away from the bathroom and you'll be fine.
author: Holly B.

description: I came here on New Years and it was outstanding. If you like dive bars, dark wood booths, and no nonsense drinks, then this is a good place to check out. The bartenders give you quick service on scotch and beer, but are usually lacking when you order your specialty yuppie drink. The door people are generally pretty nice and are good about screening the ubiquitous crackhedz of the area. However, if you pop out for a cig you will most likely end up encountering some of these compelling individuals. That's the TL in a handbasket for you. Quality.
author: Sven S.

description: I especially enjoy the idea of drinking a beer in a stronghold.  However, while I sympathize with the stress that defending a castle must impose on the wait staff, do they have to be so rude?
author: Mr. G.

description: I've been to this bar 3 times now and have had so much fun every time. The DJ in there this past Saturday night was playing all this old stuff and I loved it. Felt like the Sock Hop back in Austin at Scoot Inn bar. Bartenders are fairly attentive, interesting ecclectic crowd, pool table, oh, and the Long-Island's are STIFF. Knocked off a star cause there's only one girls toilet and i had to peeeee.
author: Krystha B.

description: The fish and chips can be hit and miss. Drink lots of beer and take a piss. I just can't get excited about this place. I saw some pretty good poetry here once, does that count? You know it doesn't.
author: patrick g.

description: Happy memories. Coins under the bar top (strange connexion with Lucky Penny? qv) .... lots of random students' parties and weird awkward shows or dance nights upstairs. I liked the offering of beers including Belhaven. Also I liked the possibility of getting accosted out front while smoking.
author: matt c.

description: Th' fesh supper willnae dissapoint, an' th' huge selection ay ales will satisfy a' fowk in yer crowd. Glorioos jukebox an' upstairs seatin'. Dornt faa!
author: Stephen H.

description: on my list of top 5 bars in sf. why? 1964 night every 2nd and 4th wednesday. $5 super strong, well drinks. great music, great people, great bartenders. I have never had a bad night at edinburgh!
author: Jaide F.

description: Great bar/pub atmosphere. PLENTY of room so your never squeezing through people, the drinks are good and never too expensive. Plenty of room to chill and sit with friends, its two story, it would be nice if they had more than one pool table but oh well. The smoking area is indoors and thats always cool, especially with the cold weather. And the fact that you could roll a blunt and smoke it makes it a keeper!
author: genna b.

description: One of the first SF bars I ever patronized and I still remember the glow-y amber/red candle holders (or was I imagining that?).  Revisitation has proven that an Irish pub with fish and chips available for order AND Tuesday Pub Night?  Can't beat it.
author: Kyla B.

description:
This is a very cool pub.  It's hugely bigger inside than it looks from the outside - large downstairs area with the bar all along the left wall.  There are 2 balconies, above each side of the room, accessed from the elevated space in back, and above the entrance to the place is a small room which often has live bands.  The place is done up very Scottish pub-ish, with a caber on the wall in the back, Scottish flags hanging from the ceiling, and the balconies are done as if they're roofs overlooking a street below, contributing a cool olde-worlde feel.
There's a big beer selection, including 1 hand-pump cask which is always worth trying.  You can also order fish & chips, which are delivered from the Old Chelsea around the corner.  These are arguably the best fish & chips available in SF - crispy, greasy, thick cut, and totally delicious, served in a rolled up newspaper.  A hot slab o' fried fish, a fresh pint, and you could almost convince yourself you're across the pond.
On the downside, I was stunned to find last night that their scotch selection has suffered a dramatic downturn.  They've less than 1/2 the bottles they used to.  I don't know why this is, but it's a sad state of affairs.
They also have regular quiz nights and other events, and have an annual Robbie Burns night, honoring the Scottish poet's birthday with bagpiping, poetry reading, and the Mighty Haggis!  You won't find a more entertaining evening in the city.
author: Don H.

description:
great interior.  love the wood.  has a very london-esque feel, and good selection of beer.

the clientele wasn't exactly eye candy, and it's in a bit of a dodgy neighborhood.  i'm not a fan of walking to a bar and having to sidestep the crackhead walking around outside going, 'PIPE!  pipe.  pipe.  PIPE!  pipe. pipe.'  the music was ok-ish.

the ladies bathroom was disgusting, and there were some guys doing coke in the area near the bathrooms (uhm, gross).  oh, and the bartender took FOREVER to get our drink orders.

affordable enough, though.

EDIT: i am bumping them up to a 4 star rating, because the irvine wlesh reading that took place there was amazing and the music was very good.
author: Claudia B.

description: Just wish I lived closer. Fish and chips is definitely worth it!
author: Alexia R.

description: I like this place, I just hate getting there. As much as I love watching people shoot up in alleys (literally, dude was putting the needle in his arm as we walked by), but you know... i saw a ska show there, that was funny. a MEXICAN ska band. we don't have that shit in Boston.
author: Veronica B.

description: This place is like caricature of a cool pub. It's crowded and the tables and pool table are not particularly well appointed forcing you to have to deal with the crowd wading by while you try to enjoy yourself.  Also did not enjoy the very rude girl playing pool nearby sticking her ass in my face while nailing me in the head with her pool cue without even saying excuse me. I don't think I'll be coming back.
author: Cathy T.

description:
you know, i'm a slow climber. we capricorns are like that.  i don't write reviews if i'm not feelin' yelpy just to get closer to elite status faster. plus i try and keep my friends equal with the # of reviews i write (so now i need one more friend...hint...hint). so...long story short... i only write when i'm truly inspired. and it just so happens that everyone i know seems to be a libra, so october has been a busy month of going out to random spots for birthdays all over town.  hence, inspiration.

with that said, this time the 1st part of the this particular bday gathering brought me to the edinburgh castle. somewhere i used to frequent back in the day, but i hadn't been in a while...the place: timeless.  still the same ol' dimly lit, big bar with beers-o-plenty, extra large round tables to seat 12+ people,  outstanding selections on the jukebox, fish-n-chips served in newspaper with malt vinegar, darts and pool....all this yet completely spacious.  i say hard to go wrong with that combo.  they have live bands and shows too upstairs.  since it was monday, it was pretty slow which was nice...we almost had the place to ourselves.  (i felt kinda bad cause there was a comedy show going on upstairs and i think they only had one person in the audience).  

all in all, a solid 4+ stars.  minus one for the bathrooms (cause they're pretty smelly), the chips were a little on the chilly side and they were outta many of the beers on tap (no biggie really).
author: Isabel C.

description: Drinks were reasonable, staffs were nice, band was entertaining(it was a concert for heiti night), it wasn't crowded because it was sunday night. I loved it!
author: Joy D.

description: Gotta love the two faucet and bucket wash room...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Its a dive, and sometimes smells too much like vinegar,but if you like stiff drinks, star tattoos galore along with tons of fashion hair, and live music upstairs a few nights a week showcasing Bay Area talent this is your spot. Oh ya order the fish and chips,but dont go to the bathroom or your table of friends will eat them all and you will then have to strangle them. Be careful on show nights, if its some up and comer the place is a zoo
author: Lauren V.

description:
comfy. 

I don't hang out in bars much because I feel awkward, but I never feel that here.  I haven't been here on a Friday or Saturday night- just Sundays and weeknights.
author: Beetle B.

description: Had dinner there last night with a former co-worker.  Great selection of beer and the fish and chips were served the traditional way in a newspaper.  Nice waitress.
author: Will F.

description: I was introduced to The Castle by a couple friends five or six years ago and I've been addicted ever since.  Its a big old wooden, Scottish pub with a huge list of different Scotch brands.  As many other reviews have listed, the place is not at all pretentious and has a warm, friendly vibe.  The jukebox is great and there is a pool table and darts in the back.  Don't forget to order fish 'n chips!  Sooo good!  Douse the fish in malt vinegar and wash it down with a Guinness.  The neighborhood can be scary and I've had hassles with the homeless who become very aggressive when they tell you they were "watching your car" and want money for their services.  My advice is to park two blocks up at the Cathedral Hill hotel on Van Ness.  They used to validate but I don't know if they still do.
author: Scott W.

description: On Tuesday nights the Edinburgh Castle has the best trivia night in the Bay Area. Its very competitive and often obscure but the questions are always fun. One time our squad got to a tie breaker for first place only to lose when I answered Indira Gandhi rather than Rajiv Gandhi. The other team had no clue but won by elimination. I will always wonder if we would have taken home the prize if I just answered Gandhi. Ahhh, missed opportunities.
author: Daniel B.

description: I inadvertently showed up on "transvestite night."  I ended up settling for the men's bathroom when the line for the women's bathroom was 10 people long.  I wonder why...
author: Margaux S.

description: The staff are nice, the atmosphere is cool, they have a smoking room and a fantastic beer called "Death and Taxes" which I had never heard of, but fell in love with after one visit to the Castle. I will definitely be back in the future...
author: Angela M.

description: bartenders were super nice. great atmosphere. good place to meet up with friends for a chill night out. after talking with the bartender, i guess it wasn't as crowded as it usually is for a friday night. good for us, bad for them. either way it was a good time.
author: Linda N.

description: Decent pub.  I liked a lot of the music they had on the juke box. I went on a wednesday night when nothing was going on. It wasn't the most lively place, but I could definitely see that place being busy on a weekend or trivia night.  Speaking of, I hear they do a great pub trivia night.
author: Angie C.

description: I went to see a friends band play here on a Saturday.  I really liked the bar and the upstairs room they played in.  I would not consider this place in Nob Hill.  It's the Loin
author: Corey V.

description:
Unless it's really crowded, the Edinburgh Castle is a dark, cool, laid-back place to get a good beer or a drink.  Though in a close-to-sketchy edge of the Tenderloin, it manages to not be a dive bar but also not be too trendy as well.  People who call this a dive bar don't really know what a dive bar is.  I usually get Chimay there.  Real dive bars do not serve Chimay.

Since I usually don't like crowds of stupid tourists or out-of-towners, places like this are often best on a Thursday or early in the evening during the rest of the week.
author: Dave N.

description: After visiting Scotland ten years ago, I formed the deluded and grand plan of one day retiring to paint and write in a small castle (with central air and heat) not too far from Edinburgh. Well, even though the economy has put the kibosh on that scotch-inspired fantasy, the Edinburgh Castle Pub offers a large, dark, great hall-like venue reminiscent of my dreamed of fixer upper. Because of the upper level, this space is good for music and literary events and includes a pool table in the back gaming area. There is generous but not fancy table seating. I prefer the bar (when I can get to it) packed with things Scottish like sports banners, books, coins, and of course, liquor! No kitchen, but orders can be run from a nearby fish and chips place that will deliver your feast in newspaper just in time for the next beer....
author: Poet D.

description: Definite dive bar with a little more emphasis on 'dive.' I ended up kicking it here after a Great American show and was happy with the beer selection and not so much with the Eurotrash and 'I Just Turned 21' crowd that seemed to be floating around. The jukebox was pretty cool and so was the upstairs, although it wasn't being used.  I sort of half expected to be mugged in the closet-turned-toilet  with no sink. Not my favorite spot in town, but I feel like I'll be here more often than not, 'cause I loves the GAMH shows.
author: Michael E.

description: The service here was quite attentive. They have hamms in a can. The fish and chips are not really that good, even though they come wrapped in newspaper. If you live nearby it is probably a good spot, but it isn't anything worth traveling to.  There are quite a few bars nearby that are much better.
author: Justin N.

description: Walk in....take a big whiff.....what do you smell?  That's right folks, malt vinegar and beer.  It's dark and there's a foul stench looming, but there is a pool table, nice jukebox selection, trivia night, upstairs area for shows, good selection of beers and fried food.  Yes, the fried food is there to compliment the malt vinegar and don't worry....after a few beers, you don't notice the putrid rank smell anymore.
author: Christina S.

description:
alright, i give.

i dont care enough to come up with witty reviews, so im going with a simple pro and con system. you might just find it useful, and hopefully a little inane.

pros:
its dark
it has alcohol
the waitress had an "I like candle wax" kind of hotness to her
pretty good fish & chips

cons:
its dark
the trivia night is too fast and serious for my taste
bar staff could go for a nap

so yeah. thats that.
author: Darrell L.

description: I absolutely adore it here ....reminds me of a little hangout back in Sydney where I logged many hours/dollars.  some people get a little dramatic with the trivia but otherwise, love it!
author: Sarah K.

description: So this place was strange. It was somewhat cool, except the crowd was not exactly my cup of tea. Although at the time I was pretty intoxicated and didn't really notice. I guess I will go back..
author: Sarah W.

description: Great jukebox. Frank the bartender is awesome. He's like a sweet teddy bear that feeds you whisky. Trivia night is cool, but I usually prefer it when it's quiet in the Edinburgh Castle. They also have pretty cool shows upstairs and fun dance nights. It's fantastic that they also serve fish and chips there from Picadilly so you can get drunk at the bar and when you feel too lazy to move and go somewhere to eat, you get a nice hearty meal that will help you soak up the liquor.
author: Jade L.

description: Used to be my favorite bar when I lived in SF years ago, although I still drop by if I'm in the area. The beer is a bit pricey considering it's the Tenderloin (rapidly gentrifying--thanks rich hipsters), and we got charged $10 for a margarita. The mustachioed bartender can be a bit on the gruff/unfriendly side; "hellos" are saved for the regulars I guess (maybe a trip to the cannabis dispensary next door is in order?). The fish and chip are soggy, greasy and overpriced...,but when you're shitfaced it probably doesn't matter.
author: James B.

description: My mom and dad used to go on dates here (!), and I now live in the neighborhood, so maybe I am biased, but whatever. I always have a good time here. Love the jukebox and the semi thrashed interior. Beware if you order the mixed seafood fry instead of standard fish and chips- it can be dangerous! Just ask my pal Ed. We were sitting at the bar and I turned to him JUST in time to watch him chomp into a fried oyster- and see the hot oil/oyster juice shoot RIGHT up his nose! He was laughing and crying at the same time! I was only laughing........with him. And at him.
author: David M.

description:
I know a bartenderess who works here.
She is sweet, stunningly gorgeous and makes a mean J&C and GGT. :)

Hipster crowd next to "Alternative Healing Bar." 

You don't have to show your ID; just a handkerchief or black painted nails.

ps. I rang in the new year aka Obama's election here. Woot!
author: A W.

description: Legendary fish & chips, served properly in newspaper.  One of my favorite pub trivia nights, too.
author: Megan W.

description: The kind of dirty, dark bar where you can go with a group of friends and get wasted off of cheap pitchers of good beer while whining about life.  It's the perfect spot for me to get out the teenage angst I never had as a teenager.
author: Katie S.

description: Home of the former Club Dare. Great stuff. #hipsters
author: John M.

description:
huge bar! everything you could want... pool table, juke box, plenty of seating, and an upstairs for shows. 1964 night is one of my favorite times to go. 
never a bad time at good ol' endinburgh castle
author: Chelsea H.

description:
this place is pretty chill. its bigger than the average dive bar, with a pool table and some interesting interior. lighting is pretty dark except for above the pool table.  drinks were normally priced; nothing fancy or really cheap.  good place to have a convo as the music was pretty quiet (i think).  

wasn't too crowded when i went here and not many ladies or people at all
author: Victor B.

description: Like most bars in the city, the Edinburgh might not be the best choice on a weekend night. Any other night, this place is a joy. The atmosphere is completely comfortable, the drinks are poured with the best intentions and you can slop up some fish and chips right on the premises. I love the cramped music room tucked in the back...perfect place to witness the rock. A friend and myself both got shot with (what I can only assume was) a bb gun while standing outside smoking one night.
author: Steven C.

description:
this place doesnt have a tele... which is, for the most part, a good thing, but i would just love the idea of coming here to catch a few epl matches. it would be a such great space to have a football hooligan fight in.

dark and tavern-y its a great place to chill and throw back a pint or five. awesomely greesy fish and chips wrapped in newspaper... just like the ones mom used to reprimand me for eating.
author: N. B. K.

description: Great pub with local flavor. I have been going to the place for years, mainly to see some crappy band that is friends of a friend or some shit - or for Karla's Black Mass.  Despite my reservations I ended up taking some Scottish & English blokes here and they adored it. The manager and door guys are always pleasant and friendly, the beers on tap are quality and there isn't any of that drunk guy rubbing up on you action that seems so prevalent in the 'loin these days. Plus you can sit with a group of friends and have a real conversation!
author: Colleen B.

description:
fish and chips. 
order some. 
make the waitress go round the corner to get it!
jukebox aint bad here.
nice ambiance. 
mixed crowd. hit or miss.
occassional hipster conventions. (good or bad, you decide)
the joy of slumming it in my hood. the TL

a nice alternative to hemlock.
won me over with fish and chips.

malt vinegar-o-meter: 3 cabers up!
author: JT X.

description: Pool, Darts, Jukebox with Irish tunes, and an itty bitty carpeted dance floor.  What else do you need?  Perhaps a bus stop right outside the bar? Ooh, got that too.  Booya.  Cheap beers, good times, and trivia nights.  God bless the Edinburgh.
author: Sarah S.

description:
i think that maybe this crowd is a little too old and boring for me.

we originally went for the soul room that was upstairs, but never ended up going in because it cost $5 which we did not want to pay.
author: A. M.

description: Definitely a dive bar, especially since they have many postings discussing the amount of purse theft they've had recently. But on a Monday night it was a good time. They even played The Streets on the jukebox. Very random but appreciated nonetheless. Beers were cheap, the clientele was strange. Strange enough for a group of them to start singing off key for no reason at all. Saw a guy in a skirt and the bartender was nice. I'll be back, just not with my purse. Keep your cash in your pocket.
author: Heather L.

description: This place is rad. It's one of my usual spots visiting the city and I have not been disappointed. Nice atmosphere.
author: Sharon P.

description: I had no idea this place was so well known.  I discovered it by accident.  It is the kind of place I used to hang out when I was in college.  Dark.  Kind of grungy but in an old worn way not a gross filthy way.  It was totally mellow.  But then again it was a Thursday night and not horribly late.  As we were leaving at 10:00 pm it was starting to fill up.  A bar like this can only be enjoyed if the crowd is mellow, I think.  Luckily, when I was there, it was.
author: sarah k.

description: Great local pub with a good selection of beer.  Spent a great New Year's Eve here, despite not being able to score the highly-touted fried Mars Bar.  You gotta love a place that has bagpipe players drop by in full-kilted splendor.
author: Andi T.

description:
i've mainly been for the pub quiz and the grand pub quiz master carl gibbs.  nothing like tuesday night pub quizzes even though with recent technology some have been known to cheat via blackberry/trio or straight dialing a friend.  the beer selection is great, and the greasiest pub food is delivered lovingly in newspaper.  

show up early to grab a table because it gets packed fast.  i ended up having to sit on the couch in the balconey when i usually love to be downstairs where all the action is.  pub quiz starts at 8:30PM.
author: Sharlene C.

description: I love the fact that you can order fish and chips at the bar and then in about 15-20 minutes they arrive wrapped in paper and tasting fried-tastic. Nice place to sit and hang out with friends, good beer selection, and a good place to see a free show. Once I spent almost an hour running back and forth to the bathroom to throw up and I can tell you that it was actually clean in the ladies' WC.  If you have to throw up in a public bathroom, this is a pretty safe place to do it.
author: Rebecca H.

description: This is how I picture drinking in an Irish pub: dark wood, long room, tables of flushed patrons.  The jukebox is great.  It's about the only place that I eat fish and chips and that's what everyone talks about (delivered to the bar from the Old Chelsea).  They are tasty.
author: T-Bone L.

description: I thought this place had a really strong community vibe. Even though it was crowded, we ended up finding a little nook where we could still carry out a conversation.  The Guiness was great, and the music on the box was diverse.
author: Mark D.

description:
wasn't too impressed - especially with the staff working the night me and some friends went.
not very friendly.

needless to say, i left before my friends did...
author: charlotte s.

description: I'd rate this place higher if the smell of vinegar didn't permeate the entire 1st floor. but it is a cool place to check out the local music scene, where they have the bands play upstairs. the jukebox rocks.
author: Chris C.

description: ITS NOT A CASTLE!!! booo....  I thought it would be... I went here to see sister spit tng.  There arent enough seats at all.  and you have to walk on the stage to go to the bathroom.  otherwise, good sized space.  We found parking right across the street.  They serve fish and chips for if you want to clog your arteries (i didnt try any) and beer and etc for those who want it. an average, good sized bar venue.
author: Merredith L.

description:
Went Saturday for someone's birthday and had a good time.  Bartenders were nice, easy space to socialize, and damn was i surprised by the sanitary--albeit cramped--ladies room.  there was an ample supply of toilet seat covers as well as paper towels by the sink, so no need to squat or rub freshly washed hands on your clothes. 
bonus points for all the coat hooks along the booths.  

i don't know if I'd go out of my way for another visit, but it's nice to go somewhere different now and then.
author: J B.

description: Great beer, great friends, great food!  This place was recommended by my boyfriends British Friends and I love it!  You can order fish and chips at the bar and they run down the street to a fish and chips joint to pick it up.  It comes all wrapped up in newspaper and is delish!!
author: Jen C.

description: Real fun place. My only concern is parking in the area. Also, minus one star for the fact that it gets RIDICULOUSLY crowded on Saturday nights.
author: Morence L.

description: Cool old time bartenders serving great beer.  Also, awesome authors come here to read their latest work...  What a cool place!
author: George M.

description: A good enough place, good selection of brews, enjoyable atmosphere, just a quick step out for a smoke. I like it over all.
author: Casey B.

description: Loved the jukebox.  Great fish and chips, but portions were a little tight.  I was hoping for an authentic pint, but they were out.  Decor was great, pool table in the back was class.  Service guy had a little edge, but kept it real.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Sasha H.

description: Dirty, smelly, annoying red light bathrooms buuuut big, spacious and good beers on tap. I know a lot of people that go there have the local fish and chips, not for me. It's too dark to really see anyone and socialize well or to play pool. I've been there twice and my opinion goes down more and more each time. It's divey...but a large dive with beer so it's worth visiting once.
author: Cassy R.

description: I really like this place.  It's a chill place without much of a scene.....although i haven't gone on a quiz night when I hear it gets really busy.  Its very roomy because the ceilings are really high and there are balconies with semi secluded booths if you want to be alone.  The drinks are cheap and strong and sitting at the bar is cool because it's made of old coins.  My favorite thing is that they have live music in the back room so you can go check it out but you can leave and join the bar part if you end up not being into the band.
author: Jessica H.

description: Good Beer and decent music.  Upon leaving the joint - they played this cool live drum jam.  Was walking distance from a friend's joint (polk and california)... man i love bars which i don't have to drive to.
author: Gerald F.

description: Came for the fish and chips, stayed for the jukebox and the whiskey.
author: Colleen M.

description: Went to their "Nightbeat" night which was pleasing.  The northern soul tunes were nice and sweet.  A little dancefloor, very dark room full of people just out to dance. At first it looked like a storage room then I took a seat to observe and let my eyes adjust.  The smell of armpits got the best of me but the cigarettes hindered the shock.  This was not a bad thing, just real and raw.  Downstairs seemed more or less kind of yuppie guests at the bar.  I'm sure we will be back
author: Van E.

description: Enter dark hallway of stone and pillar. Turn right. Turn left. Behold the glistening courtyard of twilight and beer, veranda and pool table. Climb the stairs up and up into the abyss of music, the smallest abyss you may ever find containing the enormity of sound on an isoceles triangle stage, a befitting throne room for the unknown kings and queens of rock.
author: Kimberly C.

description: I always liked this place and have fun there.  I like the upstairs space a lot.  Seems to promise more than it delivers, but what doesn't these days.
author: Ed B.

description:
for the eight years that ive lived in the bay area, ive always heard of this place, but had never been.

i googled how to get there on the bus and got dropped off in the TL from the dirty-38...omg. it was 10pm and i was alone. i didnt know where i was going...but then...there was the castle...edinburgh castle...like an oasis in a desert of filth and crackheads...

this place is great! hot waitresses, cheap drinks, lots of space, and awesome trivia night. i had formerly gone to the bitter ends trivia night, but edinburghs kicks its ass fo reals.

i dont make it out to the TL unless i go to great american, but edinburgh will be visited next time...
author: Ameigh F.

description: I originally went along to see a show, but I enjoyed the warm, dank tavern environment. I'm also a big fan of multiple levels in a drinking establishment - you're free to move about and spy on the scene below. Nice dim lighting, no frills seating, great selection of brew, and the fish + chips smelled incredible despite the fact that I don't eat flesh anymore (veg option please?).
author: Brittany L.

description: They've got enough of a beer selection to satisfy me...plus they have a nice selection of whisky which I partake in every now and then. :) Definately a hipster spot every now and then, but definately the best free rock shows in the city hands down. The dartboard needs to be replaced though - it's super worn out.
author: Justin H.

description: I don't know what the hype of this place is all about. It's a huge scenester hangout. I would rather go to Whiskey Thieves than see couples with the same hipster haircut.
author: F B.

description: My first time at the Castle was a good one, despite the fact that I was convinced I had a 50/50 shot of dying that night in a fire while seeing the band Tartufi (who for the record rocked it out despite their name) upstairs in the unfinished attic, errrrr... I mean concert space. I later learned that the place is frequented by Irvine Welsh which is appropriate (acclaimed Scotch thug writer; skip "Trainspotting" and read "Filth", a true horror story in the vein of "Heart of Darkness"). The Castle strikes me as a bar right out of Welsh's books, sans the violence. The place is dark, dank, and surly (in a charming way).
author: Rob S.

description: wednesday nights upstairs for 1964 is awesome.  otherthanthat this place is overpriced and kinda sux.  Cute 18 year old scenester girls on the weekends though.
author: Matt N.

description: Cheaper beer per pitcher than Tommy's Joynt, great fish and chips from around the corner. Nice venue area - and triva night is fun. Typically a good sized crowd, and sometimes it's standing room only - but it's close to home, and one of the few places all of my friends can agree upon.
author: Margotelyse C.

description: They have PBR on tap here!  Makes for a good night, and they usually have some sort of live music act playing upstairs which is always fun:)  Couches, pool tables, and fish and chips delivery what else can you ask for?
author: Cassie L.

description: Having been to a number of trivia nights around town, this is by far the best.  Good beer selection but at times they seem to be out of several of them.  The fish and chips are always enjoyable.
author: Alured P.

description: I went to the EC last night for trivia night and had a great time.  I've also gone on non-trivia nights and had a great time.  The place is big, the beer is good and cheap, and the guy who reads the trivia questions is funny.  I like it!  One (minor) quip: the bartender seems to ignore 75% of the bar and only takes orders from one "sweet spot" on the very long bar.  Ummmm, "sweet spot" and "very long bar" in one sentence is making me kind of uncomfortable, but you get the idea.  Laid back, dusty atmosphere is great.
author: Michelle A.

description:
randomly ended up here after a horrible time at the matrix.   lots of great beers on tap, chill people, ample room, what more can you ask for?

ps cliff's haircut sucks!
author: Todd L.

description:
A long time staple of the SF dive-bar diet, although a long way from home for me.

Solid and cheap as you'd expect with any good dive bar.

What it all comes down to for me is the people...and that's where Edinburgh Castle excels.  Case in point, I left a jacket there hanging on a hook at the bar (go figure).  Came back the next day and was psyched when the bartender came out of the back with my jacket (all contents still in the pockets!).

Try to find people like that in most other places.  I am lucky I didn't do something so dumb in a place like the matrix!  My jacket would have been gone for sure, either stolen or thrown out.  Thank you Edinbugh's Castle!  I owe you one.
author: RahBurt B.

description:
This place is cool if you can handle fish and chips that I promise you will give you the squirts or trots as we say back in Cheyenne.  

Nah, this place is OK.  You can pretend to be interested in the soccer so the wanna be Brits don't get pissed, but we all know it sucks.  

Yeah, it's clean.  Piss smell in bathroom.  I did get the chance to meet up with Geno Gann (guitarist from Pearl Jam) in there.  He was drunk off his butt and I"m certain he craped himself, but that's a story for another day.

Yo Yo, I did meet up with a honey who took me in the ladies room and did da' dirty tang' for two bills.

Hey, my boy Miguel used to pimp up in there.  Give him a shout out.  Oh and if you see Stewart Scott, Manny Ramirez, and Stephen A Smith, give them a wide berth.  They probably rolled around in the sh-t house with each other and you don't want the hep hep.

Yo Yo.
author: TJ R.

description:
This is a neighborhood/destination bar with a lot to offer. The crowd walks a line between laid-back neighborhood folks and slightly-more-uppity music-scene hipster types. The latter is naturally drawn by the live music offerings that go on upstairs virtually every night of the week. The downstairs tunes are courtesy of a solid and diverse juke box which is occasionally preempted by a live DJ. 

Tuesday night is Trivia Night and it holds a reputation as one of the best in the city. Fish and Chips are the only thing on the menu and they are rushed over in their newspaper wrapping from a nearby Fish and Chippery. Beer selection is outstanding and my beer-drinking brethren tell me some of their on-tap offerings can't be found elsewhere. 

There is a pool table and some pinball machines in the back and a piano in the front room. They have the worst dart board in San Francisco. It is just awful, as are the bar-provided darts. If you haven't figured it out yet, this is a pretty big bar, and can easily accommodate you and your twenty closest friends. 

I can't recall if I've ever had to pay a cover to get in. Normally, a cover is only charged for the live music upstairs. Staff is solid and always seems to handle the big crowds with ease. There is limited table service, at least on weekends. Overall, highly recommended. And yes, that super-cute bartender does have a boyfriend  - and an equally cute identical twin sister.
author: Phil D.

description: I've been curious about Edinburgh Castle for years, and last night I finally checked it out before going to a show at the Great American Music Hall.  The bar is ok.  It's dark and divey with a good selection of beer and it seems to fit into the neighborhood.  The bartender and the waitress were not overly friendly, nor were they particularily rude.  They just seemed kind of apathetic.  I also tried the fish and chips and was not at all impressed.  They were soggy and didn't have much flavor.  I might go back to Edinburgh Castle again as a stop before GAMH, but I doubt I'd make a special trip for the bar itself.
author: Sara H.

description: My newest dive bar.  I have only been there once, but I will rectify that as soon as I recover from this week.  Or maybe tomorrow.  Who knows?  They had a great bartender, a great selection of beer, a pool table, darts, lots of seating for various size groups, a hilarious selection of people to alternately laugh at, hate and unabashedly lust over.  The hijinks at the pooltable were insane - quarters being stolen, names crossed off the chalkboard, people sneaking games - but I think I will still go and play, and just remember that this is the pool table it's expected to cheat on.
author: Heidi P.

description: An interesting place definitely worth checking out. Good selection of single malts, free (or very nearly free) local hipster bands play upstairs, some good english pub ales  and Irvine Welsh even reads occassionally here.
author: Andrew H.

description: Great, authentic scottish pub!  After going to so many faux "Irish" pubs, this is a refreshing change.  Pool and darts are obviously a must, and a cool, low key crowd.  I don't really remember how I got here, but if I ever find myself in the tenderloin again, I will certainly be thinking about coming back here.  And kudos to the friendly door man who let me in even thought I had just lost my wallet, haha.
author: Grainger G.

description: Never had problems, even when I walked in during the middle of "last call"  bringing in my own order of fish 'n chips from around the corner.  Maybe its just me, as I can also hang n take photos in Zeitgeist with no worries.
author: glenn y.

description: I honestly used to love this place and can't say i really hate it now but the weekends have become to crowded there.  It takes me like thirty minutes to get my next drink, it sucks.  Weekdays arn't bad but the weekends have become a pain, so i don't go as much as i used to.  Great service though for the most part, ususally have some cool music, but it's not the best venue.  Prices arn't bad and the Juke Box is rocking, but I hate waiting that long for a drink.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Ok starting off the yelp career with mostly instituitions.

 I really love this place. Art, culture, truth, a sense of history, rock bands,literary events, their own publishing house, good selection of single malts and can you say Bellhaven? I can and do repeatedly.

 Crowd is mixed, I like the layout , some of the staff is has been there for years and that friggin mural is amazing. I generally play pool or  go upstairs to check out the music. I never go on the weekends so I can not tell what the crowd is like but i always have fun during the week. Not tryin to hate but those who call this place a dive lack sophistication. The edinburgh will be around long after  another 6 trendy places have come and died.....................
author: Dan T.

description: Best selection of single-malt scotch for any bar in the city under $25 per drink. Highly recommended if you want a highland single malt. Has Highland Park, my favorite highland scotch. Conspicuously lacking lowland single malts. The scotch selection is uncharacteristic of some dirty meat market with a pool table. Needs better bathrooms for rails, though.
author: Andrew A.

description:
loud, live indie-rock
$4.50 beer, hipster crowd
crowded, funky space
author: Scott S.

description:
The beer on tap is crap.  My friend ordered a PBR and I ordered a Stella.  We couldn't tell the difference between the two.

What makes this pub- is the trivia night.  It rocks!!!  The questions are tough, the picture round is horrible and the music round is down right eclectic.
author: Jessica C.

description: Oh Edinburgh, how I adore you. This Tenderloin pub is warm and cozy, with a bit of a log cabinish vibe. It is not at all pretentious...full of hipsters, yet lacking the hipster attitude. I have yet to visit for Tuesday night trivia...but a pub with a trivia night? How rad is that?! Oh, and there always seems to be something strange and/or debaucherous occurring in the girls' bathroom.
author: Kelli C.

description:
plus: saturday night and it was full of people, but the size of the bar kept it from feeling too crowded and we were able to find a table.

another plus:  lots of beers on tap including moylan's kilt lifter which is awesome and which i wish i had gotten instead of the black prince porter which was not awesome.  also had death and taxes on tap, fat lip cask ale, racer 5 IPA and many others.

not plus: i think some of the beers were on a bad tap.  the black prince tasted sour.
author: Roger P.

description: I'm afraid I don't understand the attraction of this place.  Indulging one of my sister's infatuations we ventured in in search of fish and chips and a pint.  She had heard that they served the dish in newspaper here, its authentic she said.  Early on a Tuesday evening we walked into the almost empty bar and the first thing that hit us was the overpowering smell of vinegar.  I loathe the smell of vinegar and it started to make me queasy.  We were off to a great start.  If you don't mind the smell, then this might actually be a decent place to hang, that is, if you don't order the food.  All three of us had the fish and chips, one piece of fish and french fries - $5.  Yes, it did come in  a cool newspaper package, but it was the blandest oiliest piece of fish I've ever had - gross!  As if I wasn't already queasy enough because of the smell.  Finally, to add insult to injury, there was something very wrong with my coke, it was almost completely flat and it didn't taste like coke.  The only good thing about this bar was the beer, go for that.
author: Nancy M.

description: i love this place...although i only seem to see 5 feet of it at a time since i've always been way too drunk here and always seem to be in a bubble where i'm only able to see about an arm's length in front of me.  somehow i managed to play darts (you see those holes in the lamp above the dart board...yep, that would be me).  i'm proud of the fact that i didn't fall down the stairs (there's a second floor, right?) or walk into the men's bathroom.  i keep meaning to order the fish n' chips.  maybe next time when i'm more sober...or maybe i've had them already and don't remember.
author: Jessica W.

description: went last night for the first time, absolutely loved it. great bartenders and waitresses. the music wasn't too loud, but loud enough. everyone there was very friendly. had the fried zucchini and chips, both very good. they also make a mean shirley temple!
author: Meghan B.

description: When I used to work in SF, I went to Edinburgh often enough that the waitress brought me my Tetley's without asking for an order.  It's been a few years since then and the waitress is long gone and so is the Tetley's.  And the service here has gone way way downhill, at least judging from our experience last night.  The bartender served us promptly, but when we tried to order the fish and chips from the server, she told us she'll be "right back" and didn't come back to our table EVER.  She was busy flirting with some other customers while we tried to flag her down or shoot her the "we're hungry!" looks without being too obnoxious.  About 40 minutes into this charade, we just sent two people to bring us takeout from the Old Chelsea.  In the mean time, the waitress never returned but we didn't give a shit because we'll probably just get our fish and chips directly from the Old Chelsea from now on.  It was fresher and crispier because it wasn't waiting around to be picked up by the flirting waitress.
author: maiko h.

description: This is my favorite bar in SF by default since Club Deluxe is no longer. I won't be redundant since the other reviewers have done a smashing job. I am quite glad that I have never encountered the bartender "Miss Spandex pants" though..." anyways, Burns night in January is a must, as is any time Irvine Welsh is in town doing a reading. I also like the bagpiper with the curly white sideburns. Fish and chips are good here, but NEVER go and see the place across the alley where they are actually made. It took me a year to get over that before I could start eating them again, (and this is coming from a person who has eaten at Tu Lan *despite* having a degree in public health!)
author: Mary G.

description: i liked the idea, and i especially liked the idea of swearfest... but it was too crowded, and they planned the event badly.  i'll have to come back to really review it, though i did like that you could order fish and chips!
author: Jill k.

description: i really have nothing new to say about this place except that it was really a lot greater than i expected.  plenty of seating, newcastle on tap, good lighting, nice folks running the place.  solid.
author: calamity d.

description: skinny boys with tight jeans, tight shirts, and long shaggy hair. i could dig it. went here last night for 1964. i tried hard to do the twist with a cigarette in one hand and a drink i snuck inside in the other. (sorry i'm ghetto). but the dood spazz dancing next to me got me scared i was going to burn his eyeball out with my cigarette. so i put out my ciggy and went downstairs to play pinball. my friend was celebrating his 29th birthday and he was on the verge of puking the salpicao we ate at poleng lounge earlier. so i decided not to stay very long. plus my big ass was falling outta my wannabe-skinny jeans. it's not my style. i rather have been wearing sweat pants. i said goodbye to the birthday boy that will never remember i was even there and went back home and fell asleep in my eyeliner.
author: Renae C.

description: I've always loved this place, for all the reasons there are to love it, including the decent service and reasonable drink prices.  Then I went on a recent, rather slow Monday night, only to be totally dicked by some old geezer working the bar.  It seems this guy had a hardon for me the second I walked into the room, and he served about 10 people who walked up to the bar AFTER I did before finally serving me--and he only finally did that because another customer who saw this (the geezer was being pretty obvious about it), when asked what he'd like, told the bartender to serve me first.  Then he tells me it's 14.25 for two shots of Jameson?  Maybe my memory is a little hazy, but I don't recall ever being charged prices like those at the Castle before.  Sorry if this comes across as sour grapes, but I never disrespect bartenders, here or anywhere else, I always tip at least a dollar a drink, so when someone pulls something like that for no apparent reason other than he doesn't like the looks of me, then I have to call that out.  I may not be back for a while if this is the direction the place is going.
author: Mynameisdavid M.

description: love this place.  $6 busmills, good music, chill crowd, darts, pool.  great place to hang out for an evening with friends
author: James R.

description: The 1964 dance party is amazing. It is pretty crowded but in a not overly foul way. Pretty little hispters doing the twist will swirl around you and you can enjoy a night of wholesome debauchery. Make sure to check out the adorable djs dancing behind their records they are absolutely precious. Go drink, dance, and pretend you are Joan Holloway...you know you want to.
author: Cristina K.

description: walkable from my place.  dive-y with a decent jukebox.  good space without the "im trying to be cool, but im not" attitude of hemlock.
author: Olis L.

description: i was there last night for trivia and had a good time even though my team was not so good and we were chatting and wandering around the bar more than paying attention to the questions.  the place looks like a typical dive bar and there is plenty of seating.  i'd go back to see a show or play trivia again.
author: Seong P.

description: the ultimate pub quiz in town - made special by the intelligent carl.  from last tuesday's shenanigans, it looks like carl is finally fed up with our regular attendance and regular quiz night failure that he took mercy on us with a drink ticket on the sly.  we love you carl!  and the super pretty waitress who for some reason thinks we're cool (all thanks to my sis-in-law), thanks for providing and partaking of the jameson.  oh and to the peewee champs that get hated on...i think you're cool and all them haters can suck it.
author: J.R. R.

description: been coming here since i was a wee lad. love to sit and relax (that is if it isn't bagpipe nite) and drink a pint of ale. the crowd is cool in a relaxed way. the real deal.
author: ray c.

description: i had an absolute blast here on trivia night. the announcer guy was hilarious and a bit drunk but so where we so it was all good. walking up to the place i thought it was a bit sketchy, but once inside, i realized that this was one of the most awesome pubs ive been to in SF. loved the dark lighting, ginormous bar, and ample seating. also really loved the stiff drinks that the bartender with the british accent made for me :) he rocks my socks. i'm definitely going next tuesday for the special category "Serial Killers and how they do it!"
author: Aly L.

description: great spot in the tenderloin.  been a bunch of times to see friends' bands play over the years.  the inside is kind of neat... i like that its not all new and shiny inside, but rather looks a bit worn.  gives the place a lot more character.  they have a second floor that overlooks the downstairs with little booths that you can sit at.  love that you can get fish 'n chips, which i believe they get from someplace down the street.  the fried mushrooms are amazing!  great beers on tap, not pretentious at all, at least the times i've been.  only downside is that the room where they have live music (upstairs) feels a bit cramped and it can get rather warm in there.
author: Yvette H.

description: not a bad pub, they have an upper area, pitchers, trivia night, lots of space.  some drunk girls 'lost their' shoe and it came flying off the balcony, had they been properly kicked out i would have done four stars. some people (bitches) just can't handle their liquor
author: kiki b.

description: i went there for one of the litquake events and it seems like a cool place. i liked the ambiance and the size, there seemed to be a lot of seating, and there was a good selection of drinks. there website lists a lot of readings and events and considering how much i enjoyed saturday's readings, i have high hopes. i also saw a sign for trivia night...
author: Joy F.

description: nice rustic pub complete with fish and chips served in authentic-ishpaper...but for f*ck's sake was the pub quiz HARD!  I really didn't expect it to be so obscure, and to top it off every other team there were hardcore "i come every week to kick pub quiz ass" teams...
author: jozilla w.

description: loads of great scotch behind the bar and a decent beer selection, but no pints of heavy.  if edinburg castle had heavy i don't think i would ever leave.  fish and chips come in newspaper, nice.
author: Markus B.

description: another good place to see local bands.  plus i love the lighting.  i've said it once and i'll say it again: BARS NEED GOOD LIGHTING, THX.  they have lots of beers which is nice, and make very strong drinks.  the jukebox is pretty cool, it's rare to find echo and the bunnymen on a jukebox, and it makes me happy.  the bathrooms are really gross though.
author: Kate W.

description: trivia is fun and all but all that vinegar just smells like sweaty socks.
author: marin m.

description: this place is alright. i've been here more times then i ever needed or wanted to be. they have a decent selection of beer but the bartenders aren't too friendly. every other wednesday is hipster night... they call it 1964. dancing upstairs, whoo-hoo. on tuesday it's trivia night. i try to avoid tuesdays. hardly any people, the questions are boring. i'd rather be at whiskey thieves or the hemlock. probably though, you'll find me at home.
author: Tara A.

description: A lot of good beers on tap and spacious.  I like that you can bring outside food in to eat.
author: LT B.

description: I've had the fish and chips here a couple of times. They're good, if a bit greasy. But that's part of the charm. The beer selection is great and the place has a great vibe. Also has pool and darts, two bonuses. You can hang out downstairs with the crowd, or go upstairs for some quiet. And I hear the trivia night rocks.
author: andrea a.

description: favorite setting of a bar...seemed like it had lots of beer choices...one of the interesting names was "death & taxes" beer....did not try that though....the day i went was pretty crowded with some sottish festival going on...would love to go again though...
author: saroj y.

description: Its like a little hidden nook. Walking in we weren't sure were the front entrance would lead us.....prob to some seedy bar, but turning the corner we laid eyes on a big open and airy bar/pub! Sweet! Drinks and prices were decent. Music was fun. Someone told us they have little bands play upstairs sometimes....would like to check that out someday. The crowd was a little TOO hipster in my opinion....I'm kinda getting sick of it honestly. But whatevs. And they have food, didn't know that....which is cool. I love the tavern/castle/cave atmosphere.
author: Diana D.

description: Its not a surprise that people often cite this Scottish import as one of the best dives in the city. Great service, always some sort of entertainment, alot of seating options and a seperate upstairs seating area and performance room. If you want fish and chips order early as when things start picking up it can be a wait if you get them at all. I've easily spent upwards of 8 hours in this place without boring myself. A neighborhood bar as it should be.
author: Sequoia N.

description: Just been visiting the place during trivia nights on tuesdays. But the place is great with nice interior and lovely fish and ships. Recommended!
author: Andy K.

description: the bartender pissed me off last night. this is why this place only gets 2 stars. i've been coming here for a LONG time - yet the bartender wearing those unusual outfits ... you know, the girl who always wears  those skin tight gym shirts with stalkings on underneath ... yeah, pretty ridiculous ... well, anyways, if anyone knows me, i'm the nicest guy in the world, anyways, i've ordered PLENTY of drinks off this girl before and i'm always very generous with my tips, but she always has an attitude and last night took the cake. first of all, i ordered a stella right when i got there ... i gave her a $1.50 tip on a $4 beer ... it was warm and flat. so, i did what i would always do - return it. she gave me this attitude and was all bitchy to me. i ordered several other beers that night and she was still bitchy to me ... yeah, i know, surprising. i also asked her if i could store a bag behind the bar ... and remember, i'm pretty much a regular here, and she gave me this attitude and said no. whatever ... pissed me off. this girl needs to learn a thing or two about working in a scottish bar ... learn some manners, please. i hope you read this, miss spandex pants.
author: James J.
